title: U.S. lawmakers question Pompeo over Saudi crown prince
text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. lawmakers on Wednesday pressed Secretary of State Mike Pompeo to explain why the Trump administration has determined that Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman was not responsible for the murder of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi.
subject: politicsNews

title: Trump urges Republicans to drop plan to avert shutdown
text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - President Donald Trump on Friday urged fellow Republicans in Congress to abandon a plan to avert a government shutdown next week and demanded they fund his long-promised wall on the U.S. border with Mexico.
subject: politicsNews

title: Turkey slams U.S. remarks on Khashoggi killing as attempt to whitewash crime
text: ISTANBUL (Reuters) - Turkey on Saturday dismissed remarks by U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo about the investigation into the killing of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi as an attempt to whitewash the crime.
subject: worldNews

title: Taiwan says China’s ‘bullying’ behavior will backfire
text: TAIPEI (Reuters) - China’s “bullying” behavior towards Taiwan, including pressuring international firms to refer to the island as part of China, will backfire, Taiwan’s foreign ministry said on Friday.
subject: worldNews

title: Explainer: How could the Senate deal with Saudi Arabia after Khashoggi case?
text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The U.S. Senate is expected to vote next week on a resolution condemning Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman for the murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi, and on several measures putting pressure on the kingdom to end the war in Yemen.
subject: politicsNews

title: Senate panel weighs next steps on Saudi Arabia after Khashoggi murder
text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A U.S. Senate committee will consider this week what steps to take in response to the murder of Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi, as pressure builds in Congress for a tougher stance against Saudi Arabia and its crown prince.
subject: politicsNews

title: Questions mount over Trump's Russia dealings
text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump’s former personal lawyer Michael Cohen has said he lied to Congress about a proposed Trump Organization skyscraper in Moscow, and that Trump knew about it all along.
subject: politicsNews

title: Trump says he will nominate Barr for attorney general, Nauert for U.N. envoy
text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - U.S. President Donald Trump said on Friday he would nominate William Barr, who served as attorney general under President George H.W. Bush, to reprise the role in his administration.
subject: politicsNews

title: White House backs Senate effort to end Yemen war, despite differences
text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The White House is “fully on board” with a Senate effort to pass a resolution calling for an end to U.S. military support for the war in Yemen, even as administration officials seek to ease the measure’s language, a top aide to Vice President Mike Pence told Reuters on Friday.
subject: politicsNews

title: After Pompeo briefing, key senators say more warranted on Khashoggi killing
text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Key U.S. senators said on Wednesday they were more convinced than ever that Saudi Arabia’s Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman was involved in the murder of journalist Jamal Khashoggi, after hearing a classified briefing from Secretary of State Mike Pompeo.
subject: politicsNews

title: Top Republican senator says Trump should have firmer line on Russia
text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A top Republican U.S. senator said on Sunday that President Donald Trump needs to adopt a firmer line against Russia, and said the United States should be taking stronger steps to deter Russian aggression.
subject: politicsNews

title: New evidence suggests collusion between Manafort and Russian: The Guardian
text: WASHINGTON (Reuters) - A new report in the Guardian newspaper suggests there was collusion between President Donald Trump’s former campaign manager Paul Manafort and the Russian government, U.S. Representative Adam Schiff said on Saturday.
subject: politicsNews
